The claim made by Donald Trump was that: Right now we’re the highest taxed country in the world."
The expert: s verdict states that the claim could be accurate if Trump had been more specific, particularly regarding the corporate tax rate.
The expert analyzed tax data from the Or: OECD) to compare the United States with other countries.
According to the data: the United States ranks 27th out of 30 countries in terms of taxation as a percentage of GDP, and 17th out of 29 countries in terms of tax revenue per capita. This contradicts Trump's claim that the US is the highest taxed country in the world.
